page.title: 03Work in the Coal Industry
page.content: The majority of the men who live in Tumble and the surrounding area still work in the coal industry. They dig for Anthracite Coal which is the best source of energy in the world. The mining operations are carried out at Cynheidre Colliery which is approx. 12Km. from Tumble and at a private coal mine about 1Km. from the centre of the village. Cynheidre is the only surviving mine left in the Gwendraeth Valley. The men travel to Cynheidre by private cars and buses or by N.C.B. transport. There are 3 work shifts, night, day and the afternoon shift. They go to work dressed in clean clothes. On arriving at the colliery they change into their working clothes in the pit head baths. Before going underground they are issued with a safety helmet and a lamp.
